org.funcito

Class FuncitoGuava

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.funcito.FuncitoGuava

  • public class FuncitoGuava
extends Object
    This class is the static entry point of the Funcito API for Google Guava.

    • Method Detail

      • callsTo

        public static <T> T callsTo(Class<T> clazz)
        Generates a proxy object for use with other FuncitoGuava static methods. This proxy should not be used for any other purposes. It is a convenience pass-thru to FuncitoDelegate.callsTo(Class). Example usages are: 

         
     // inlined:
     Function<MyClass,RetType1> func = functionFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithRetType1() );

     // or extracted for repeat usage
     final MyClass CALLS_TO = callsTo(MyClass.class);
     Function<MyClass,RetType1> func2 = functionFor( CALLS_TO.method1WithRetType1() );
     Function<MyClass,RetType2> func3 = functionFor( CALLS_TO.method2WithRetType2() );

        Stubs are cached, so this method can be called multiple times for the same class without penalty. But a single proxy can also be reused for creating multiple Guava Function or Predicate objects.

        Parameters:
        clazz - is the class to be proxied
        Returns:
        a proxy which can be used by other FuncitoGuava static methods

      • functionFor

        public static <T,V> Function<T,V> functionFor(V proxiedMethodCall)
        Generates a Guava Function object that wraps a method call or method chain. Resulting Function is as thread-safe as the method itself. Example usage is:

        Function<MyClass,RetType1> func = functionFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithRetType1() );

        You can wrap methods with parameters, so long as you statically provide values for each parameter. Provided parameter values are statically bound to the Function and may not be changed:

        Function<MyClass,RetType1> func = functionFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithArgs("abc", 123L) );
        // all invocations of func will use "abc" and 123L as the arguments to methodWithArgs

        It is also possible to wrap method call chains, with some restrictions:

        MyClass callsTo = callsTo(MyClass.class);
        Function<MyClass,RetType2> func = functionFor( callsTo.methodWithRetType1().methodWithRetType2() );

        Restrictions for chaining are that intermediate return types (all except for the final return type in the chain) must be proxyable by the current Proxy provider, just like the initial target type. In the above example this means MyClass and RetType1 must be proxyable, but RetType2 need not be proxyable. Intermediate return types also cannot be a Java Generic type because of type erasure.

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the return value from a method call to a FuncitoGuava proxy object
        Returns:
        a Guava Function object that wraps the method call or chain.

      • functionFor

        mode - is the TypedMode that modifies the mode of execution of the resulting Function

        See Also:

      • predicateFor

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateFor(Boolean proxiedMethodCall)
        Generates a Guava Predicate object that wraps a Boolean- or boolean-return method call or method chain. Resulting Predicate is as thread-safe as the method itself. Auto-boxing means you may always safely wrap a method that has a primitive boolean return type. Example usage is:

        Predicate<MyClass> pred = predicateFor( callsTo(MyClass.class).methodWithBoolRetType() );

        Users of this Predicate should be aware of a risk with Guava Predicates (not specific to Funcito) if the return type of the method being wrapped is a Boolean wrapper rather than a primitive boolean. Such calls are allowed, but there is an inherent null-pointer risk because Guava Predicate.apply(T) returns a boolean primitive. See overloaded form of this method predicateFor(Boolean, boolean) for a mitigation of this risk.

        This method also supports wrapping methods with arguments, and method chaining, as documented in functionFor(Object).

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the Boolean return value from a method call to a FuncitoGuava proxy object
        Returns:
        a Guava Predicate object that wraps the method call or method chain.
        See Also:
        predicateFor(Boolean, boolean)

      • predicateFor

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateFor(Boolean proxiedMethodCall,
                            boolean defaultForNull)
        Generates a Guava Predicate object that wraps a Boolean- or boolean-return method call or method chain. Resulting Predicate is as thread-safe as the method itself. This form of the method is only required when there is a risk of the wrapped method returning a null-value, in which you case you provide the default value to substitute for null return values from the wrapped method.

        This method also supports wrapping methods with arguments, and method chaining, as documented in functionFor(Object).

        Parameters:
        proxiedMethodCall - is the Boolean return value from a method call to a FuncitoGuava callsTo object
        defaultForNull - is the default value that Predicate will return if the wrapped method returns a null-value.
        Returns:
        a Guava Predicate object that wraps the method call or method chain.
        See Also:
        predicateFor(Boolean)

      • predicateFor

        public static <T> Predicate<T> predicateFor(Boolean proxiedMethodCall,

        Returns:

        See Also:
        predicateFor(Boolean), Modes, TypedMode
